intro: Olamblis, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes a variety of herbaceous plants. The plant features showy, yellow flowers with five petals, often surrounded by a ring of sepals. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, meaning they are divided into three parts. Olamblis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats.
